intro: Corispermum pamiricum var. pilocarpum, commonly known as the Pamir sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Central Asia. It is a member of the Chenopodiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid and saline environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, continental climates. Its seeds are encased in a hard, dry fruit, typical of the Caryophyllales order.
